Intermediate Vocabulary - Page 8

Intermediate

Intermediate Vocabulary - Page 8

Strengthen your vocabulary with these essential intermediate words commonly used in business and academic environments.

Navigation

This is page 8 of 15. Use the navigation below to explore all vocabulary pages.

Word List

Create

/kriˈeɪt/

verb

To bring something into existence; to cause something to happen.

"The artist will create a sculpture for the museum."

Synonyms: make, produce, generate

Category: Creation

Culture

/ˈkʌltʃər/

noun

The arts and other manifestations of human intellectual achievement; the customs and beliefs of a particular group.

"She studied different cultures during her travels abroad."

Synonyms: civilization, society, tradition

Category: Society

Decision

/dɪˈsɪʒən/

noun

A conclusion or resolution reached after consideration.

"Making this decision was not easy, but it was necessary."

Synonyms: choice, determination, resolution

Category: Choice

Define

/dɪˈfaɪn/

verb

To state or describe exactly the nature, scope, or meaning of something.

"Can you define the term 'sustainability' for the class?"

Synonyms: explain, describe, clarify

Category: Explanation

Demand

/dɪˈmænd/

noun, verb

An insistent and peremptory request; to ask for something forcefully.

"There is a high demand for skilled workers in technology."

Synonyms: request, requirement, need

Category: Request

Describe

/dɪˈskraɪb/

verb

To give an account in words of someone or something.

"Can you describe what happened during the meeting?"

Synonyms: explain, detail, portray

Category: Communication

Design

/dɪˈzaɪn/

noun, verb

A plan or drawing; to decide upon the look and functioning of something.

"The architect presented the design for the new building."

Synonyms: plan, blueprint, create

Category: Planning

Develop

/dɪˈveləp/

verb

To grow or cause to grow and become more mature, advanced, or elaborate.

"The company plans to develop new software applications."

Synonyms: grow, evolve, advance

Category: Growth

Difference

/ˈdɪfərəns/

noun

A point or way in which people or things are not the same.

"There's a significant difference between the two proposals."

Synonyms: distinction, variation, contrast

Category: Comparison

Discuss

/dɪˈskʌs/

verb

To talk about something with another person or group of people.

"We need to discuss the budget for next year."

Synonyms: talk about, debate, confer

Category: Communication

Distribute

/dɪˈstrɪbjuːt/

verb

To give shares of something to a number of recipients.

"The teacher will distribute the handouts to all students."

Synonyms: share, allocate, spread

Category: Distribution

Document

/ˈdɑːkjəmənt/

noun, verb

A written or printed paper; to record something in written form.

"Please sign this document to complete the registration."

Synonyms: record, paper, certificate

Category: Recording
